title: Cordell Hull
summary: Cordell Hull (October 2, 1871 – July 23, 1955) was an American politician from Tennessee and the longest-serving U.S. Secretary of State, holding the position for 11 years (1933–1944) in the administration of President Franklin Delano Roosevelt during most of World War II.  Before that appointment he represented Tennessee for two years in the United States Senate and twenty-two years in the House of Representatives.
